snippet: When Dan Price announced he was setting a minimum salary of $70,000 for his 120 employees, he didn’t foresee the turmoil it would cause for his business.
abstract: Decision by Gravity Payments founder and chief executive Dan Price to set new salary floor of $70,000 for his employees, and cut his own salary to do so, drew attention from around world, but also caused turmoil for company; success of model could have wide-reaching consequences, but company's continued existence is threatened by lawsuit filed by Price's brother and co-founder, as well as by loss of customers and workers uncomfortable with salary policy many see as political statement about income inequality.
lead_paragraph: When Dan Price announced he was setting a minimum salary of $70,000 for his 120 employees, he didn’t foresee the turmoil it would cause for his business.

headline.main: A Company Copes With Backlash Against the Raise That Roared
